page.title: 01SHERINGHAM TODAY.
page.content: {Sheringham}is a small pleasant seaside town on the{North Norfolk coast.} It is mainly a place where retired people come to live but there are 408 children in the primary school. It was originally a{fishing village}but after the First World War it became popular for holidays. It now has a population of 4,940. Boats still fish from the beach and the{town is famous for crabs {and lobsters.} There are many lovely walks to be enjoyed on the cliffs, the commons and through the woodlands near the town. Other{special features}are the 18 hole golf course, the private steam North Norfolk Railway and the Little Theatre. We have two lifeboats. One is named the "Henry Ramey Upcher" and is looked after by the Preservation Society. The other is the present one "Manchester Unity of Oddfellows."
